channel.title: Re elect obama?
channel.description: just trying to see what people think its a school thing. :)

item.title: Re elect obama?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:345, topic:436416”]I’m related to Martha Washington.

But M1lkman pulls his facts outta his ass.[/quote]

What facts? I’m all about opinion.

Read full topic

item.title: Re elect obama?
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:345, topic:436416”]I’m related to Martha Washington.

But M1lkman pulls his facts outta his ass.[/quote]
I’m related to everybody.
If your dad had 2 parents, and your mom has 2 parents, that’s 4 extra people, then multiply that by 2 because they each had 2 parents, 8 people, then 16, and so on.

Eventually it leads on to you being related to everybody who ever lived in the world. Yes, even the chinese.

Read full topic

item.title: Re elect obama?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:329, topic:436416”]It’s for the good of the country.

No sense in arguing this point if you aren’t an American.[/quote]

do you have any statistics that show older people run a country better?

m1lkman:

Barack Obama is too young.

yet he isn’t the youngest president the states has seen, and there have been 17 presidents within 5 years of obamas age, are you saying all those presidents weren’t qualified to run the country as well? or is it just obama and the 4~ other presidents that were younger than him?

m1lkman:

I meant that we shouldn’t be bringing in a citizen of Britain to run our country. A president should love his country. I don’t think a citizen from another country can love a different country.

besides the obvious points to make (how would one measure how much a person loves a country? should presidents that love the country less than foreign citizens not be allowed to be the president?), to be a president in the united states you NEED to have been native-born, or have both parents who were native-born, one does not simply become a president of the united states without being an american

Read full topic

item.title: Re elect obama?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Wet Dreamss, post:342, topic:436416”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=539128.msg3986434#msg3986434 date=1335928391]

I meant that we shouldn’t be bringing in a citizen of Britain to run our country. A president should love his country. I don’t think a citizen from another country can love a different country.

First, you are right, George Washington was the worst president ever. ( I don’t see why we shouldn’t consider him as British.
Two, name one candidate that loves America more than they love money and their donors.
Three, let the people decide who they vote on.

Everyone was considered British in the Revolution.

Third point taken. I withdraw my statement.

I’m confused, george bush isn’t british;o?

George Washington. The “1st” President.

GEORGE BUSH WAS FIRST PRESIDENT IDIOT

Media is just supporting romney, so ofc whos gonna win?

can’t tell if trolling or really stupid.

cant tell if or if
[/quote]
very if.[/quote]
Yeah, probably if!

But really its not like Obama had much to work with from the beginning… so… lets just let the next guy in line try!
VERMIN SUPREME FOR PRESIDENT

For real Ron Paul 2012 :3

Read full topic

item.title: Re elect obama?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:333, topic:436416”]m1lkman: So you are implying that “the best for the country” is more important than being democratic? It seems like you think the American population is a bunch of children. If you cannot trust the people to take the right decisions, then you are at the path of totalitarianism.

And I like that you say that lots of experience is a requirement. Are you in favour of dictatorship?
Since Gaddafi had a lot of experience before he was unlawfully executed, wouldn’t he be the perfect candidate for Libya with all his experience?

What is wrong with radical leaders? If young people understands that the big parties are just a bunch of liars, then this is a good thing.[/quote]
Barack Obama is too young. He is raising two daughters and running a country. You can’t do both. One learns lessons as a parent. These lessons can be incorporated into running a country. This is the experience I am talking about.

When I said

It’s for the good of the country.
I meant that we shouldn’t be bringing in a citizen of Britain to run our country. A president should love his country. I don’t think a citizen from another country can love a different country.

Radical leaders can be good and bad. Look at Zuckerberg and how he runs his business. He does things by himself. Yes it is a billion dollar company but what if he slips up? Makes one mistake? Young radical leaders are more prone to making big mistakes.

Read full topic

item.title: Re elect obama?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

m1lkman: So you are implying that “the best for the country” is more important than being democratic? It seems like you think the American population is a bunch of children. If you cannot trust the people to take the right decisions, then you are at the path of totalitarianism.

And I like that you say that lots of experience is a requirement. Are you in favour of dictatorship?
Since Gaddafi had a lot of experience before he was unlawfully executed, wouldn’t he be the perfect candidate for Libya with all his experience?

What is wrong with radical leaders? If young people understands that the big parties are just a bunch of liars, then this is a good thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Re elect obama?
item.dc:creator: @JUMPHIM JUMPHIM
item.description:
@JUMPHIM wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:330, topic:436416”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=539128.msg3985408#msg3985408 date=1335821458]
It’s for the good of the country.

No sense in arguing this point if you aren’t an American.
[/quote]
Im an American and I argued this point and youre still retarded

Elect someone right out of college and they’ll be more conservative and wise than someone who has had their life set in stone for 15-20 years. Leaders 40+ years old cant compare their childhood to the new generation of children. Its completely different.[/quote]
i agree. at the same time a think there should be 2 old and young. maybe they can find common ground

Read full topic

item.title: Re elect obama?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:330, topic:436416”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=539128.msg3985408#msg3985408 date=1335821458]
It’s for the good of the country.

No sense in arguing this point if you aren’t an American.
[/quote]
Im an American and I argued this point and youre still retarded

Elect someone right out of college and they’ll be more conservative and wise than someone who has had their life set in stone for 15-20 years. Leaders 40+ years old cant compare their childhood to the new generation of children. Its completely different.[/quote]

Was talking to bowser.

So someone who has heard about life but never experienced it should lead the country? You need to experience life before you even think of running for president. Ronald Reagan was 80+ years old. When he was 20, I’m pretty sure he was thinking about making movies rather than running the country. Young people are too radical to be a strong president.

Read full topic

item.title: Re elect obama?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Why make a rule about the requirements about who could be president, why can’t you let the “democracy” decide.
If someone want Frell or a 64-year-old Austrian as president, why should people be allowed to vote on them?

PS: Never elect an Austrian to anything. (Does not apply to Austria).

Read full topic

item.title: Re elect obama?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

The same applies.

item.title: Re elect obama?
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:325, topic:436416”][quote author=Frell link=topic=539128.msg3984982#msg3984982 date=1335758503]

They need to up the presidential requirement age to 55.

No, they don’t. Younger people have a better grasp on person freedoms and rights than older people do.
[/quote]

There are certain things a president needs to experience before he or she becomes a president. One would be a family; if you can’t lead your family, you have no right trying to lead a country. And yes, I believe the president should have a family before he wants to be president.

Older people are wiser and have more experience.[/quote]
When you just said “before he wants”
What would happen if we got a female president.

Read full topic

item.title: Re elect obama?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:323, topic:436416”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=539128.msg3984614#msg3984614 date=1335732449]
They need to up the presidential requirement age to 55.
[/quote]
No, they don’t. Younger people have a better grasp on person freedoms and rights than older people do.[/quote]

There are certain things a president needs to experience before he or she becomes a president. One would be a family; if you can’t lead your family, you have no right trying to lead a country. And yes, I believe the president should have a family before he wants to be president.

Older people are wiser and have more experience.

Read full topic
